title_sort: alonzo s. bush to walt whitman, 11 february 1864
title: Alonzo S. Bush to Walt Whitman, 11 February 1864
text: Friend Walter,Sir accordain[according] to promis[promise] I now embrace this opportunity of informing you of my Safe arrival at Hed[Head] Quarters of 1st Ind Cav. My Friends gave me a warm reception Such as how are you Bush got robed did you &c I told them how it came to pass and how much I lost and finely that Washington was a hard place I tell you that Hoosiers are a fraid[afraid] of thieves and murders and it made them open their eyes when they found out that I had been bit. Well I feel at home here and dont[don't] think I will come to the city untill[until] I am muster out for goodEverything is lovely down here and the goose hangs high the weather has been pretty cold cince[since] I came back and therefor we have had no hunt as yet. I was just in time for the boat. I had the pleasure of meeting my Capt G. Lutt so I was not alone had quite a nice time told them how long I had been in city and what kept me you ought to here them laugh at me for not being sharper I told them it would be all right in cours[course] of time live & learn is my moto[motto].Walter I told that friend of mine about you and he thinks he will like you very much I showed him your Photograph. he liked it very much. Walter tell Benedict & Brown not to forget me and not send there to me. There is nothing going on here at presant[present] and I have nothing to write every thing is same day after day no changes. We have plety[plenty] to eate[eat] & wear and nothing to do.We are all waiting for the 8th June so that we can go home and see our Sweet hearts. I supose[suppose] you know what they are. If you dont[don't] I do and I long for to see mine very much and I think she will want to see meâ€”give my letter the least notice possible and oblidge[oblige] yours remember me to all the Boys at armory Squre[Square]. Hoping to receive that Fatherly letter from you soon I will close good by Alonzo S. Bush to Walt Whitman, 11 February 1864
